Sentencas: Practical applications of single-chamber solid oxide fuel cells (SC-SOFCs) are partially limited by the difficulties and complications associated with the initialization process, which mainly involves the reduction of NiO to Ni in the anode.
Titulo: Single-chamber solid oxide fuel cells with nanocatalyst-modified anodes capable of in situ activation

Sentencas: Here we propose a facile approach to the in situ activation (initialization) of SC-SOFCs with a state-of-the-art sintered nickel-based anode using a methane oxygen gas mixture, combined with the introduction of nanocatalysts into the anode.
Titulo: Single-chamber solid oxide fuel cells with nanocatalyst-modified anodes capable of in situ activation

Sentencas: RuO2, CeO2 or Co3O4 with the high activity for methane oxidation are investigated for above purpose.
Titulo: Single-chamber solid oxide fuel cells with nanocatalyst-modified anodes capable of in situ activation

Sentencas: XRD results demonstrate that the nanocatalysts are successfully introduced into the anode via a simple solution impregnation technique.
Titulo: Single-chamber solid oxide fuel cells with nanocatalyst-modified anodes capable of in situ activation

Sentencas: Using FESEM, different nanoparticle morphologies are observed for the three catalysts.
Titulo: Single-chamber solid oxide fuel cells with nanocatalyst-modified anodes capable of in situ activation

Sentencas: The time dependence of the cell voltage operating on the methane oxygen gas mixture demonstrates successful activation following nanocatalyst introduction.
Titulo: Single-chamber solid oxide fuel cells with nanocatalyst-modified anodes capable of in situ activation

Sentencas: Single cells with different nanocatalyst-modified anodes, initialized by in situ reduction, deliver high open circuit voltages of approximately 1.0 V and significant peak power outputs of approximately 1000 mW cm(-2) at a furnace temperature of 650 degrees C. XRD and FESEM analysis indicates that only the CeO2 retains a same structure and morphology after the test.
Titulo: Single-chamber solid oxide fuel cells with nanocatalyst-modified anodes capable of in situ activation

Sentencas: It suggests that the CeO2 nanocatalyst is the most promising for practical applications.
Titulo: Single-chamber solid oxide fuel cells with nanocatalyst-modified anodes capable of in situ activation
